name: Open Day
fullDescription: Open Day is ERC's premier annual exhibition held in the first semester of each academic year, where we showcase our cutting-edge research projects to academic partners and visiting institutions. Hosted in the D-Spine of BITS Pilani, Goa Campus, this event attracts distinguished faculty members from our college, dignitaries from various academic institutions, and students from nearby schools. Beyond demonstrating technical excellence, Open Day serves as a platform to ignite curiosity among young minds and foster meaningful collaborations with the academic community.
location: D-Spine, BITS Pilani K K Birla Goa Campus
highlights: Interactions with visiting professors and dignitaries
School outreach to inspire young students

name: Quark
fullDescription: Quark is the annual techno-management festival of BITS Pilani, K.K. Birla Goa Campus, and ERC takes center stage with an impressive exhibition of innovative mini-projects. Our teams begin preparations a month in advance, crafting projects that captivate visitors alongside industrial participants. Beyond showcasing our work, we collaborate with the organizing committee to conduct hands-on workshops designed to ignite curiosity among those new to robotics. Held in the second semester, Quark generates significant footfall and serves as a testament to ERC's commitment to making robotics accessible to everyone.
location: BITS Pilani K K Birla Goa Campus

name: Eduspark
fullDescription: Eduspark represents ERC's commitment to social responsibility through our collaboration with Nirmaan, an NGO dedicated to uplifting underprivileged communities. During this event, we showcase select projects to children from underserved backgrounds, explaining complex engineering concepts in simple, accessible terms. The highlight of Eduspark is allowing the children to take control of our robots themselves—witnessing their excitement and curiosity is immensely rewarding. We take immense pride in supporting this cause and inspiring the next generation of innovators, regardless of their background.
location: Student Activity Centre, BITS Pilani Goa Campus

name: Prof Talk
fullDescription: Prof Talk is ERC's annual academic enrichment initiative where we invite distinguished professors to share insights into their ongoing research and academic experiences. These sessions provide our members with a unique opportunity to understand the current landscape of robotics and electronics research, gain exposure to emerging technologies, and engage in meaningful discussions with experts in the field. Prof Talk bridges the gap between classroom learning and real-world research, inspiring students to pursue innovative projects and academic excellence.
location: BITS Pilani K K Birla Goa Campus

name: ERC ROS Hackathon
fullDescription: The ERC ROS Hackathon is our flagship competitive event, conducted entirely online each summer to maximize participation from students across the country. This hackathon challenges participants to solve complex robotics problems using the Robot Operating System (ROS), testing their skills in simulation, navigation, and autonomous systems. With approximately 40 teams participating in recent editions, the hackathon has grown into a highly anticipated event in the student robotics community.

name: CTE Techweekend
fullDescription: CTE Techweekend is an exhilarating 2-day hackathon-style event organized in collaboration with the Centre for Technical Excellence. Held during the second semester of the academic year, this event challenges participants with engaging technical competitions including bidding wars, capture-the-flag challenges, and more—all with an attractive prize pool on the line. CTE Techweekend is designed to push the boundaries of technical skills while fostering healthy competition and peer learning among students.
location: BITS Pilani K K Birla Goa Campus

name: QSTP
fullDescription: Quark Summer Technical Projects (QSTP) is ERC's summer learning initiative designed to make technical education accessible to students of all experience levels. During the summer break, we offer structured project-based courses covering topics such as mechatronics, reinforcement learning, neural networks, and embedded systems fundamentals. Each program features carefully crafted lesson plans with weekly assignments, guiding participants from foundational concepts to hands-on project completion. QSTP embodies our belief that quality technical education should be available to anyone with the curiosity to learn.
highlights: Topics: Mechatronics, RL, Neural Networks, Embedded Systems

name: Inductions
fullDescription: ERC Inductions is our annual recruitment drive where we welcome passionate students into the club. The process includes technical assessments, hands-on tasks, and interviews to identify students with genuine interest in electronics and robotics. Selected members join ongoing projects and contribute to the club's growth.
